children.value: Custom incident actions provide a user assigned to an incident with a quick way to execute custom logic housed outside of the PagerDuty system. Customers can host their own custom scripts that execute when these actions are executed, which provides users with a nearly limitless number of possible actions.

Once you have created your custom action, you will see the action button available on all incidents on that service.

When a user clicks on this button, it will fire an HTTP POST request with data on the incident to the endpoint URL specified during configuration. You can then build a script that listens for this request and executes custom logic when a request is received.

button that fetches diagnostic data on the affected infrastructure and appends the data as a note on your PagerDuty incident. This gives your users visibility into key infrastructure data right in the PagerDuty incident.

button that will revert the last commit in your repository that houses the source code for the affected service. This allows your users to quickly roll-back a bad deploy without leaving the PagerDuty platform.
